subject: Officiating (Sports)
Interscholastic Athletics
organizations: Kansas State High School Activities Association
lead_paragraph: Kansas officials were investigating the refusal by a school to let a female referee call a boys’ high school basketball game. The Kansas State High School Activities Association said referees reported that Michelle Campbell was preparing to officiate at St. Mary’s Academy near Topeka on Feb. 2 when a school official insisted that Campbell could not call the game. The reason given, according to the referees: Campbell, as a woman, could not be put in a position of authority over boys because of the academy’s beliefs. Campbell walked off the court with Darin Putthoff, the referee who was to work the game with her.
